importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most recent update on the ongoing MLB postseason action, specifically the ALCS between the Blue Jays and Mariners, highlighting the current stage of the playoff race.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame from October 20 to October 21, 2025, is critical because it covers the decisive Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, with the winner advancing to the World Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers.

keyTakeAways: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 in a pivotal Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, pushing the series to a decisive conclusion.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth postseason home run, tying him with José Bautista and Joe Carter for the most in Blue Jays history.
Rookie pitcher Trey Yesavage recorded seven strikeouts and three double plays, including two consecutive bases-loaded inning-ending double plays, marking a historic defensive feat in postseason play.
The Blue Jays have made only four errors in 10 playoff games, demonstrating strong defensive discipline.
The Mariners, who have never won a pennant, are making their first appearance in a Game 7, highlighting the significance of the matchup for their franchise history.
The Blue Jays are set to face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series beginning Friday, after the ALCS conclusion.

This game marks the first time a Blue Jays player has reached a postseason Game 7, with Vladimir Guerrero Jr. being the first to do so in his family lineage — his father, Vladimir Guerrero, never played in a Game 7 during his career.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit his sixth postseason home run, tying the record for most in Blue Jays history and becoming the first member of his family to play in a Game 7.

namedEntities.name: Trey Yesavage
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A rookie pitcher for the Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched 5 2/3 innings, struck out seven, and recorded three double plays, including two in consecutive innings, marking a historic defensive achievement in postseason play.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They won a decisive Game 7 against the Seattle Mariners, advancing to the World Series and completing a historic postseason run.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He never played in a postseason Game 7, making his son's achievement a historic first in the family lineage.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He expressed determination to 'lay everything out there' in the Game 7, reflecting the team’s commitment to fighting through adversity.

namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They will face the winner of the ALCS in the World Series, setting up a high-stakes matchup in the final stage of the postseason.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays defeated the Seattle Mariners 6-2 in a dramatic Game 7 of the American League Championship Series, advancing to the World Series. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. hit his sixth postseason home run, tying the record for most in Blue Jays history, while rookie pitcher Trey Yesavage delivered a strong performance, including three double plays and seven strikeouts. The Blue Jays, who had lost four consecutive postseason games before this series, turned a critical defensive moment into a victory by forcing the Mariners into multiple errors. The Mariners, who have never won a pennant, are now facing their first Game 7 in franchise history. The Blue Jays’ victory marks a historic moment for the Guerrero family, as Vladimir Guerrero Jr. becomes the first in his lineage to reach a Game 7. The next game is scheduled for Monday, with Toronto starting Shane Bieber and Seattle starting George Kirby.
title: Blue Jays Edge Mariners in Game 7 to Advance to World Series
